Package pieces

Class Knight

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Knight
public class Knight
extends Piece
Knight is a subclass of the abstract class Piece. A knight can move three spots where two of the spots are horizontal in the same direction and the other spot is vertical `* in any direction and vice versa.
Author:
William McFarland, Vincent Phung

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Knight​(java.lang.String color)
    initializes a Knight piece

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Square> getAtkPath​(Square[][] board, Square cur, Square dest)
    Creates and returns a list that contains the squares that form a path from the current square to the destination square based on the type of piece on the current square.
    boolean pathBlocked​(Square[][] board, Square cur, Square dest)
    Determines whether the piece on the current square can reach the destination square without any pieces in between its path.
    java.lang.String toString()  
    boolean validMove​(Board boardObject, Square cur, Square dest)
    Determines whether the current type of piece can move from cur to dest based on the chess rules for each piece.

  • Method Details

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove​(Board boardObject, Square cur, Square dest)
      Description copied from class: Piece
      Determines whether the current type of piece can move from cur to dest based on the chess rules for each piece.
      Specified by:
      validMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      boardObject - An instance of the board class.
      cur - The currently selected square.
      dest - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
      Returns:
      True if the piece on the current square can successfully move to the dest square.

    • pathBlocked

      public boolean pathBlocked​(Square[][] board, Square cur, Square dest)
      Description copied from class: Piece
      Determines whether the piece on the current square can reach the destination square without any pieces in between its path.
      Specified by:
      pathBlocked in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
      cur - The currently selected square.
      dest - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
      Returns:
      True if there are no pieces in between the path of cur and dest.

    • getAtkPath

      public java.util.ArrayList<Square> getAtkPath​(Square[][] board, Square cur, Square dest)
      Description copied from class: Piece
      Creates and returns a list that contains the squares that form a path from the current square to the destination square based on the type of piece on the current square. Path does not include cur or dest squares only the squares in between the two.
      Specified by:
      getAtkPath in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
      cur - The currently selected square.
      dest - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
      Returns:
      A list of squares that form a path from cur to dest.
